categories.name: Overview
categories.about: Authentication is central to many other lines of the API life cycle. There are several common elements present in modern API solutions that address authentication.

building_blocks.name: Test Token Generator
building_blocks.about: Providing the ability to generate test tokens for use in authenticating with the API.

building_blocks.name: Authentication Overview
building_blocks.about: An overview of how authentication is handled for a platform, and which formats are supported, setting expectations for consumers.

building_blocks.name: Authentication Tester
building_blocks.about: Providing a testing tool for authentication, that allows developers to test key and Basic Auth to oAuth, to help them understand how authentication works and if they are using proper credentials.

building_blocks.name: OAuth Scopes
building_blocks.about: Providing a dedicated page or section to listing out the different OAuth scopes used by a platform. Providing a transparent window into all the scopes available, and some of the logic into why they exist.

categories.name: Approaches
categories.about: There are a handful of approaches to authentication that have been embraced by leading APIs, as well as the overall industry.

building_blocks.name: Basic Auth
building_blocks.about: Usage of the basic authentication format that is part of the standard HTTP operations, employing a username and password as credentials for accessing API resources.

building_blocks.name: Key Access
building_blocks.about: Providing simple tokens, often called API key as a common way to access to APIs, issuing one to each developer and per application they register.

building_blocks.name: JSON Web Token
building_blocks.about: JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information between parties as a JSON object.

building_blocks.name: oAuth
building_blocks.about: Providing an oAuth layer to API operations, securing high value APIs, while also opening up a conversation between an API platform, developers, and end-users regarding the access of their content and data.

categories.name: Additional
categories.about: Any additional considerations when it comes to API Authentication for providers, and consumers.

building_blocks.name: Two Factor Authentication
building_blocks.about: Allowing API consumers to turn on and employ two factor authentication, requiring an additional component to making changes to account security, either by  SMS or authenticator app.
